title: Experimental evidence to confirm weak acid

content.question: A student titrates <math alttext="25 milliliters" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>25</mn><mo> </mo><mtext>mL</mtext></math> of a <math alttext="0.10 molar" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>0.10</mn><mo> </mo><mi>M</mi></math> solution of an unknown acid, <math alttext="H X" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>HX</mtext></math>, with a <math alttext="0.10 molar" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>0.10</mn><mo> </mo><mi>M</mi></math> solution of sodium hydroxide, <math alttext="N a O H, aqueous" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>NaOH</mtext><mpadded><mo>(</mo><mpadded><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi></mpadded><mo>)</mo></mpadded></math>, to the equivalence point. Which of the following pieces of experimental evidence would best help the student confirm that <math alttext="H X" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>HX</mtext></math> is a weak acid?

choices.label: The initial <math alttext="p H" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>pH</mtext></math> of the acid solution is greater than <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math>.
The initial <math alttext="p H" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>pH</mtext></math> of the acid solution is less than <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math>.

Less than <math alttext="25 milliliters" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>25</mn><mo> </mo><mtext>mL</mtext></math> of <math alttext="N a O H, aqueous" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>NaOH</mtext><mpadded><mo>(</mo><mpadded><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi></mpadded><mo>)</mo></mpadded></math> is required to reach the equivalence point.

More than <math alttext="25 milliliters" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>25</mn><mo> </mo><mtext>mL</mtext></math> of <math alttext="N a O H, aqueous" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>NaOH</mtext><mpadded><mo>(</mo><mpadded><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi></mpadded><mo>)</mo></mpadded></math> is required to reach the equivalence point.

content.answer: The initial <math alttext="p H" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>pH</mtext></math> of the acid solution is greater than <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math>.

skill.text: 2.C: Identify experimental procedures that are aligned to a scientific question (which may include a sketch of a lab setup).
